title: Module 3: Mastering Lead Management Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of lead capture, qualification, and conversion in Dynamics 365

questions.question: What is the first step in the lead management process for broadcast advertising sales?
options: Qualifying the lead's budget
Capturing and recording lead information in Dynamics 365
Scheduling a sales meeting
Creating a proposal
questions.explanation: The first step is capturing and recording lead information in Dynamics 365, ensuring all prospect details are properly documented in the system for tracking and follow-up.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically part of the BANT qualification criteria?
options: Budget - Does the prospect have the financial resources?
Authority - Can the contact make purchasing decisions?
Beauty - Is the prospect's office aesthetically pleasing?
Timeline - When does the prospect need the solution?
questions.explanation: BANT stands for Budget, Authority, Need, and Timeline. 'Beauty' is not part of the qualification criteria - the focus should be on the prospect's ability and readiness to purchase.

questions.question: In broadcast advertising sales, what information is most critical to capture when a lead first inquires?
options: Their favorite TV shows and radio stations
Company name, contact details, advertising goals, and budget range
Personal hobbies and interests
Office location and building architecture
questions.explanation: Critical lead information includes company name, contact details, advertising goals, and budget range - information that helps determine if they're a good fit and how to best serve their needs.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of lead scoring in Dynamics 365?
options: To rank leads based on their likelihood to convert into customers
To assign random numbers to leads
To determine the lead's credit score
To calculate the lead's age
questions.explanation: Lead scoring ranks leads based on their likelihood to convert into customers, helping sales professionals prioritize their efforts on the most promising prospects.

questions.question: When should a lead be converted to an opportunity in Dynamics 365?
options: Immediately after the lead is created
After the lead has been qualified and shows genuine interest and fit
Only after a contract is signed
Never - leads and opportunities are separate
questions.explanation: A lead should be converted to an opportunity after it has been qualified and the prospect shows genuine interest and fit for your broadcast advertising services.

questions.question: What happens to the original lead record when it's converted to an opportunity?
options: The lead record is deleted permanently
The lead record is typically deactivated and linked to the new opportunity
The lead record remains active and separate
The lead record is automatically duplicated
questions.explanation: When converted, the lead record is typically deactivated and linked to the new opportunity, maintaining the connection while moving the prospect into the active sales process.

questions.question: In broadcast advertising, which lead source would typically have the highest conversion rate?
options: Cold calling from purchased lists
Referrals from existing satisfied clients
Random website visitors
Social media followers
questions.explanation: Referrals from existing satisfied clients typically have the highest conversion rate because they come with built-in trust and recommendation from someone who has experienced your services.

questions.question: What is the benefit of tracking lead sources in Dynamics 365?
options: It helps identify which marketing channels are most effective
It's required by law for all businesses
It automatically increases lead quality
It reduces the number of leads you receive
questions.explanation: Tracking lead sources helps identify which marketing channels are most effective, allowing you to invest more resources in the channels that generate the best quality leads.

questions.question: How should you handle leads that don't meet your qualification criteria?
options: Delete them immediately
Convert them to opportunities anyway
Mark them as disqualified with clear reasons and consider nurturing for future opportunities
Ignore them completely
questions.explanation: Disqualified leads should be marked with clear reasons and considered for nurturing campaigns, as their situation may change over time and they could become qualified prospects later.

questions.question: What is lead nurturing in the context of broadcast advertising sales?
options: Providing ongoing value and staying in touch with prospects who aren't ready to buy immediately
Calling leads every day until they purchase
Sending the same sales pitch repeatedly
Ignoring leads until they contact you again
questions.explanation: Lead nurturing involves providing ongoing value and staying in touch with prospects who aren't ready to buy immediately, building relationships and staying top-of-mind for when they are ready.

questions.question: Which activity is most important when following up with a new lead in broadcast advertising?
options: Sending a generic brochure immediately
Understanding their specific advertising goals and challenges
Asking for a signed contract on the first call
Discussing your company's history in detail
questions.explanation: Understanding their specific advertising goals and challenges is most important, as it allows you to tailor your approach and demonstrate how your services can address their unique needs.

questions.question: How can Dynamics 365 automation help with lead management in broadcast advertising?
options: It can automatically assign leads to sales reps based on territory or expertise
It can send automated follow-up emails and reminders
It can track lead engagement and update lead scores
All of the above
questions.explanation: Dynamics 365 automation can handle lead assignment, send automated follow-ups, track engagement, and update lead scores, freeing up sales professionals to focus on high-value activities like building relationships and closing deals.
